DNSMonitorEnabled.description: If enabled, the agent will monitor DNS traffic.

DNSMonitorPolicy.description:
What action to take if the DNS monitor cannot start when enabled. Enforce will
stop the agent with an error, while Warn will post a log and continue on.

ID.description: ID is the identifier of the object.

allowedPauseInterval.description:
An administrator can set this for users to pause enforcement for this interval.
A value of 0s means that users are not allowed to pause the enforcement.

disableManagedCA.description:
If disabled, the agent will rely on the CA already installed and trusted on the
system.

disableSystemProxyManagement.description: If disabled, the system proxy needs to be configured manually.

disableURLDiscovery.description: If disabled, the agent will stop reporting the visited domains.

enablePause.description: If enabled, the agent will have the ability to pause enforcement.

importHash.description: The hash of the structure used to compare with new import version.

importLabel.description:
The user-defined import label that allows the system to group resources from the
same import operation.

listeningPort.description: The port use by the agent to proxy the traffic.

name.description: The name of the agent configuration.

pacName.description: The name of the PAC configuration to use.

pingInterval.description: The ping interval at which acushield should check in with the backend.

updateTime.description: Last update date of the object.

useDynamicPort.description:
If system proxy management is enabled and this flag is enabled, the system
can take another port, different that the listeningPort.
